info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 2:17AM CDT until July 13 at 4:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Sutton.
* WHEN...Until 415 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 215 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2596 And Ranch Road 864, I-10 Near The Sutton-kKmble County Line and Us-277 Near The Sutton-Edwards County Line. - This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 406 and 433. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING
